alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:36PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Apache. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has ended, however, minor flooding is expected to remain while the water recedes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Carrizo Wash, Lower Lyman Ditch, Jarvis Wash, Little Colorado River, Hall Creek, Fish Creek, Nutrioso Creek, Carnero Creek, Vigil Run, Big Hollow Wash, Lang Creek and Coyote Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyman Lake State Park, Lyman Lake and Becker Lake. - This includes the following highways... Highway 180 191 between mile markers 378 and 394. State Route 373 near mile marker 386. State Route 260 between mile markers 383 and 388. Highway 60 between mile markers 373 and 386. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
